intro: Sisymbrium harra, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has alternate, pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are short, cylindrical pods that split open to release tiny seeds. Sisymbrium harra is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
